Agent selector dropdown displays agent name and title from bundle.yaml
Optional: Display bundle name as subtitle (e.g., "Alex - Requirements Facilitator")
Selecting agent loads from bundle structure (bundle.yaml file path)
Agent metadata (icon, description) available for UI enhancement (optional for MVP)
Empty bundles folder shows "No agents available" message

doc.title: Epic 4 Story 4.6: Refactor Agent Discovery for Bundle Structure
doc.section: Epic 4: Agent Execution Architecture & Bundle System
doc.snippet: Story 4.6 refactors Epic 3 Story 3.4 agent discovery to use bundle manifests. Frontend calls /api/agents to receive bundled agent list with metadata from bundle.yaml. Agent selector displays name, title, optional bundle name subtitle. Empty bundles show "No agents available" message. Malformed bundles logged but filtered out gracefully.

doc.title: Story 4.6 Implementation - Refactor Agent Discovery for Bundle Structure
doc.snippet: GET /api/agents endpoint returns list of available agents from bundles using discoverBundles(). Response format includes {id, name, title, description, icon, bundleName, bundlePath, filePath}. Uses centralized error handling with handleApiError.

doc.title: Bundle Manifest Structure and Agent Discovery
doc.snippet: Bundle manifests (bundle.yaml) define agent metadata including id, name, title, description, icon, and entry_point flag. Multi-agent bundles have agents array; standalone bundles have single agent object. Discovery scans bundles/*/bundle.yaml at depth 1.

doc.title: Agent Orchestrator PRD - Bundle Architecture
doc.snippet: Bundle architecture emerged from Epic 2/3 validation. BUNDLE-SPEC.md defines standardized structure for agent organization. Epic 4 implements bundle-aware discovery replacing Epic 3 XML-based approach.

doc.title: Story 4.4: Bundle Structure Discovery and Loading
doc.snippet: Story 4.4 implemented discoverBundles() function in lib/agents/bundleScanner.ts. Scans bundle.yaml manifests, validates structure, extracts agent metadata with bundle context. Story 4.6 consumes this functionality via API endpoint and frontend.

doc.title: Story 3.4: Agent Discovery and Selection Dropdown (Original Implementation)
doc.snippet: Original XML-based agent discovery scanned agents/*/*.md files for <agent> tags. Story 4.6 replaces this with bundle manifest-based discovery. Frontend component AgentSelector.tsx exists and needs refactoring for bundle metadata.

constraints.constraint: Use existing discoverBundles() from Story 4.4 - do not reimplement bundle scanning logic
Maintain backward compatibility with Epic 3 UI layout - AgentSelector should fit existing ChatPanel structure
Type safety: Reconcile AgentSummary vs AgentMetadata types - either update AgentSummary or use AgentMetadata consistently
Error handling: Malformed bundles must not crash UI (AC-4.6.7) - use try-catch and filter invalid bundles
Empty state: Show "No agents available" when bundles directory empty or no entry_point agents (AC-4.6.6)
Bundle context: Selected agent must pass bundlePath to chat API for proper initialization (AC-4.6.4)
Optional enhancement: Bundle name subtitle is optional for MVP (AC-4.6.3) - implement if time permits
Testing: Integration tests must verify end-to-end flow from bundle discovery ‚Üí API ‚Üí UI display
